data.proxyObjectName: tall black Tesla-branded stainless steel water bottle with silver cap
clear plastic jar or container (stackable design)
data.utilizationMethod: Hook two fingers through the lip of the jar while the thumb braces the outer wall, treating the rim as a circular handle. Lift and tilt it; the jar’s cylindrical body and empty volume give a convincing mug outline, and if you partially fill it with water it can add the desired mass without altering the object.

data.proxyObjectName: grey and white camouflage-patterned video game controller
data.utilizationMethod: Grasp the controller by a single grip horn so the rest of the body hangs outward as a weighted head. Swinging this asymmetrically held mass offers torque that strives to rotate the wrist downward, analogously to how an axe head tries to drop during a chop.

data.proxyObjectName: green plush turtle shell with white rim
data.utilizationMethod: Curl your fingers around the white plush rim, letting the large soft dome hang over your fist like an oversized, padded hammer head. Its considerable size and off-centre mass make the head dip naturally, while the softness lets you perform full swings and feel a cushioned yet abrupt stop when it contacts a surface.

data.proxyObjectName: black telescopic selfie stick with adjustable phone holder
data.utilizationMethod: Hold the rubberized black grip as the sickle handle; extend a single telescope segment so the rod plus phone clamp form a curved, forward-projecting mass. The distributed weight along the rod closely mirrors a sickle blade, allowing full-scale elbow and wrist sweeps that replicate harvesting strokes.
